ygData.subject: Re: Phenotype XML
ygData.msgSnippet: ... the recurrent ... one but ... No problem. :) As far as converting to SVG, no the id is *not* optional.  In order to associate other graphical attributes

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:
> Ok, understood. So would you say that both the id and 
the 'recurrent' 
> flag can be considered optional? Sorry to seem pedantic on this 
one but 
> I want to be 100% sure we're all undestanding each other.

No problem. :)

As far as converting to SVG, no the id is *not* optional.  In order 
to associate other graphical attributes to a connection (such as its 
corresponding weight), it needs to have a unique identifier.

I cannot create one dynamically because XSL does not allow for the 
updating of variables, so it needs to be explicit in the XML.

As far as the recurrency tag, that could be considered optional for 
graphical representation (as you say, you'll just get all black 
connections), but it is necessary for determining how the network 
functions.  

Now would probably be a good time to hash out what we mean when we 
use the term "recurrent". :)  

In terms of our implementation (and I believe Ken's) any connection 
which creates a loop, including self-connections, is considered 
recurrent. 

We probably do need a way to represent different functionality (yes, 
the fact that all of your connections have a memory, and combine the 
output from the previous timestep with the current one, works a bit 
differently than the standard NEAT network...someone correct me if 
I'm wrong here).

> If the recuurency flag is an integral part of the network's 
operation 
> then yes I agree.

Yeah, I pretty much think it is, though again, we probably need to 
hash out a clear common usage of the term.

Derek
